post_title: Never saying anything (on twitter)
post_body: Is it weird that I check my twitter several times a day, spend a lot of time reading other people's tweets but rarely tweet anything myself? Yesterday somebody tweeted that they found it scary that there might be somebody out there reading tweets but never tweeting themselves. I asked them why it was scary and they didn't reply.

post_title: Feeling suicidal
post_body: I have aspergers, OCD, depression and all that. I've been suicidal for a long time. Sometimes things got better. But they always get worse somehow. College was my hope. A job. A future. Thanks to stupid councellors and those stupid medications I managed to screw up previous semester. I'm on the way to mess up this one too. They'll cancel me financial aid. Or put me on probation. Or just kick me out. I dont like living at home due to aspergers and shit. And I dont have anywhere else to go. I'm thinking about taking my own life this week. But I dont wanna hurt my mom. She wont be able to take it. I have no idea what to do.

I need somebody, anybody to get me through this
post_body: I've been battling depression for several years now. Things were better for a good part of last year. But since last quarter of previous year, things have gotten worse. much worse. I've hit rock bottom. Nothing seems to be helping. Things I used to enjoy doing seem dull. I lie in bed hoping to disappear and come back when things are better. Cant even fucking sleep anymore. Its been soooo long since I had a good night's sleep. Everything's sooo fucked up. I feel like killing myself is the sole option left. But I still want to fight. I dont want to quit just yet. Its just that it seems like the only goddamn solution. I turned to my ex gf to help me out. But she doesnt wanna get back together and I ended up humiliating her in the worst manner. I hate myself for that. Whole thing was a mess. I just hope I could find somebody. Somebody to talk to. Somebody who would get me through this. Its getting harder and harder to cope all on my own. I havent had a converstion with another human being in around 10 days. Geez

ASD and multitasking?
post_body: Are People with ASD known to have serious multitasking problems? Because for me it's nearly impossible to do two things at a time or concentrate on multiple things at the same time. For example, unlike most people I can never concentrate on a lecture while taking notes or checking a text message on phone. I seem to lose track of what the instructor was saying very fast. Also, I can't listen to music and solve math questions at the same time. I can't even read an article on the web while listening to music. Similarly, when I'm watching sports on tv and I switch my attention to phone for checking twitter updates, I instantly lose focus of both. I can neither make much sense of tweets nor the match because I'm trying to focus on both. While most people on my twitter timeline or on IRC channels seem to be able to manage this very very well. Likewise, when I'm trying to concentrate on something it's like my other senses have stopped working. If i'm doing something (or even just thinking a random thought) and someone talks to me, I almost always have to ask them to repeat what they just said. How common is this problem?edit: another thing that just came to mind. Inability to focus on both audio and video in movies. Things seem to happen way too fast for me. Hence I always need subtitles while watching movies/tv shows. And if a movie doesn't have subtitles like in cinemas, i come out all confused not having understood most of the storyline for whatever reason.  This might also be because most movies/shows I watch are in english and english is not my native language but I seem to understand it very well. I've probably watched more american tv shows than even most americans. I have read a lot of english books and all. I can read, speak and understand english just fine.

post_title: ASD and excessive fatigue
post_body: Is there a correlation between ASD and fatigue? I seem to get tired very easily and need to rest (take an hour long nap e.g) to just get through the day. I started noticing this in high school and the problem has only exacerbated since then. Back in HS, just two/three classes would wear me out physically as well as emotionally and I would spend the rest of the day with moderate to severe headache not concentrating in classes at all. Now that I'm in college, I don't have to take consecutive classes but still whenever I take two classes in a row, I come back to my room and take a long nap. This despite getting at least 7/8 hours of sleep every night. My roommate gets through the day easily and only sleeps at night.Even when I'm not taking classes i.e I have a few days off, I can't study for extended periods of time. It gets harder and harder to focus as time passes. This has been getting in the way of me taking part in various activities and I doubt I'll be able to work long hours when I graduate. I consulted a physician long before I was diagnosed with ASD but he basically came up with nothing. I sought help of college physician too but she blamed this on laziness.

post_title: _PERSON_ _PERSON_
Appropriate Xanax dosage?
post_body: I've recently started taking Xanax to treat my anxiety/panic attacks. I'm not the kind of person who would take drugs for recreational purpose so this was like the only option I was left with after my anxiety got unbearably bad (to the point of me wanting to take my own life) and I started breaking down almost everyday. Due to my poor past experiences with psychiatrists and financial problems, I don't want to see one and am looking for a solution on my own.  I'm currently taking 2mg/day in the form of two 0.5mg pills in the morning and two in the evening. Is this amt. appropriate? also although i feel it is helping me and I feel better than before, I still feel quite anxious most of the time. Should I start taking more of Xanax? if yes, how much of it and at what time? btw I'm 20,M and a college student.

post_title: Just fucked up a presentation
post_body: I didn't want to present in the first place but my group made me. I practised at least twenty times, presentation was good, content was good but I couldn't deliver very well. I tried looking at the instructor or the slides with occasionally staring at the audience. I know this isn't the best way to present but even managing this was a huge deal for me.  Instructor's response at the end: This is the worst way to present and you are fucked. I told him about my anxiety and all but it's unlikely he'll give it much weight.  I'm done with this sh*t. I gave it all. I practised about 20 times. Still came up short. And I have zero motivation to go further. I have another presentation in the morning, tomorrow and I absolutely have zero motivation to prepare for it. This is it. I'm done.  Edit: biggest thing pissing me off right now is why is it not the content that should matter the most? LISTEN to what i have to say and ignore the freaking presentation skills for a moment. Why is it always the other way round? I'm here to talk, not to dance.

post_title: Persistent communication problems
post_body: It's so frustrating not to be able to 'just converse' with people. And not just IRL. On phone too. I've been in an on-again, off-again relationship for a long time and the biggest problem i've faced is to not be able to talk like most people. I just sit quietly in front of her with my head absolutely blank. On phone, i ask her a few cliché questions which she's not interested in talking about, eventually ending up scratching my head trying to figure out what to say. A lot of times, the frustration results in me making a joke she finds offensive or me saying something i regret later. Simple miscommunication has resulted in a lot of discontent.  I haven't had a conversation that lasted more than 5 mins and didnt revolve around studies with my mom/dad/uncles/cousins in years. Just being in their presence makes me feel so very uncomfortable. This is the biggest reason i simply avoid seeing people. Communication problems coupled with anxieties of all sorts make the whole process very difficult. And seeing people able to converse so well effortlessly makes this feeling all the more worse. I see people saying stuff to each other and think 'why does any of this never occur to me'? I've tried noting down interesting stuff that i can say to people, stuff i see IRL or on TV but it hasn't made much of a difference. The only proper conversations i have with people revolve around my special interests or studies. There are many ASD related issues that have significantly affected my life but this is one of the things that depress me the most.  Please share any tips that have helped you people and can help me deal with this and salvage whatever is left of my relationship.

post_title: Dealing with Xanax withdrawal
post_body: I took xanax for one month starting with 1.5mg dose/day eventually tapering it down to 0.5mg/day before quitting. Reason i quit was it wasn't helping me one bit.   Now that i'm off it, i'm experiencing severe side effects. My insomnia has gotten much worse, I feel exhausted all day and I have the worst headache. I tried getting melatlonin to improve my sleep but it's very hard to come by where i live. Any advice on how i can deal with withdrawal symptoms? Any alternatives to melatonin that you may be aware of or any other medication that's known to help people ease their way through benzo withdrawal?

Mind not absorbing information
post_body: Recently i've had trouble absorbing what i'm reading. There was a time, not so long ago, when i could read for hours just fine. But now just two or so hours into it my mind reaches a sort of saturation point where i just feel mentally exhausted and my mind doesnt absorb anything i'm reading. I usually need a nap for this to go away. But even after taking a nap it comes back real soon. I've been wondering if this has anything to do with anxiety/depression etc. or is a side effect of medication i'm taking. I started my medication (cipralex+elaxine) a couple months ago

post_title: What should I know for a Management Trainee interview at GlaxoSmithkline?
Detailed notifications in Action Center?
post_body: Action center would become a lot more useful if MS just allowed apps to display detailed notifications. That way we won't have to open the app every time to get a detailed status. One scenario where this could be useful is sports apps like sofascore. I currently have toasts enabled for it so that it sends me goal alerts and so on. However, since Action Center doesn't display full notifications, I have to open the app every time to find out who scored the goal and so on. A weird limitation.  Also, why is it not possible to clear individual notifications from Action center? What if I just want to clear one and keep the rest for an app as a sort of reminder for later? A better implementation imo would've been 'swipe the app title to the right to remove all notifications, swipe a notification to the right to remove just that one'. When I first used the Action Center, I was expecting it to be like this. It was disappointing to find out that is not the case.
